Name: DecisionStepUncertaintyMapper
Archetype: Sequential decision-tree analysis with uncertainty propagation
Purpose: Map where in the step-by-step investment flow beginners experience the highest uncertainty about what to do next, and why those specific steps feel intimidating
Deliverables: Decision tree model of the full investment journey (onboarding to first investment) where each node is labeled with: required inputs, implied commitments, missing-information points, and a 'novice uncertainty index'; includes identification of steps where branching without clear criteria leads to paralysis
Strengths: Effective at identifying precise stages (e.g., choosing account type, selecting contribution amount, picking investment type) where users are most likely to stall or abandon due to unclear decision criteria; good at exposing how compounded uncertainties across steps create an overall sense of being overwhelmed
Watch-out: Performs poorly when flows are underspecified or non-sequential; cannot evaluate visual aesthetics, brand trust, or long-term financial suitability; must avoid inferring or advising on risk levels, time horizons, or cash-flow planning; must not design new flows or educational content, only analyze where and how uncertainty accumulates in existing flows
